robert laing <r.laing@...=

> require 'rubygems'
> require 'base32'
=
> cmd =3D IO.popen("openssl sha1 #{ARGV[0]}")
> puts Base32.encode( cmd.rea=
dline.split("
> ")[1].to_a.pack("H*") )

You could also use Ruby=E2=80=99s =
builtin sha1:


--Multipart_Wed_Apr_30_11:12:45_2008-1
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII

require 'rubygems'
require 'base32'
require 'sha1'
d = SHA1.new
d << File.read(ARGV[0])
puts Base32.encode(d.digest)


--Multipart_Wed_Apr_30_11:12:45_2008-1
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII

best,
Erik Hetzner
